Reviews.Title: “Super staff, terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaEileen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to Amsterdam. As others have noted, it's a gorgeous property but what really made the trip memorable was the staff, especially the doorman Rene. The whole staff makes you feel you are, if not the only, then certainly the most important, guests.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lmhatch
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day trip from Amsterdam and an excellent stay at the Hotel De L'Europe. We stayed in a one bedroom suite in the newly refurbished Dutch Master's Wing with a view of the Amstel. The suite's many amenities were impressive. Bose sound system (with IPOD hook up), a room IPAD, free Wi Fi (so refreshing not to pay for Wi Fi!), luxurious linens and an elegant bathroom. We very much enjoyed Hoofdstad Brasserie and Freddie's Bar. Most impressive was the staff. Many of the staff have been with the property for years and their commitment to excellence is evident. Each staff member went out of their way to make our stay more comfortable and to help with plans for each day, including hotel management who can often be found in the lobby ready with helpful suggestions and guidance. One of our best trips to Europe at one of the best hotels in Europe. We are already planning our next trip to the Hotel De L'Europe!!

Reviews.Title: “Royal stay in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Egil O
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the Premium Deluxe Room with my family. Excellent room standard with iPad available at the nigth table and free WiFi. Delicious royal style bathroom. Staffs friendliness, hospitality and quick response to requests made the stay even better. Very nice breakfast served in the room. Location at Muntplein is perfect with 5 min walk to Rembrandtplein.11 tram and bus lines halts just outside and connects you with all parts of the city. Only drawback was the credit card bill I received back home, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I believe the best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: parker2011
Reviews.Content: A very good location in the old city center with wonderful views to the Amstel. The entire hotel has been recently refurbished with good taste and comfortable solutions in the public areas. The equipment in the rooms is remarkable, with a very comfortable bed and bathroom. The friendly attitude of all the staff, from the doorman to the manager on duty is surprising. All our requirements were solved efficiently and promptly as one can expect in a five star hotel, but unfortunately too often the service received in de luxe hotels is a â€œfour and a halfâ€� being generous in the qualification. Good quality food and excellent service for breakfast and dinner. Freddieâ€™s Bar is a must to be visited. I believe it is the best hotel in Amsterdam and no doubt it is in the select bunch of best hotels in the World. Bravo Â¡Â¡

Reviews.Title: “Walk anywhere in the city from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Myron K
Reviews.Content: An old world hotel right in the middle of Amsterdam. Nothing in the city was more then 10 minute walk from our hotel. The rooms were just re-done and very nice. Only bad thing I can say about this hotel, was in the am the staff was VERY loud in the hallway and woke my wife and I. Otherwise, the only place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Remodel First Rate”
Reviews.Author: richardsonsnm1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at De L'Europe several times since 2001, the most recent March 15th for three nights. This was my first time back since the hotel was remodeled. I brought friends with me, we both had Deluxe Junior Suites, canal views, me on the 2nd floor, them on the 3rd. From the lobby to the room, perfect. Check in was a breeze, front desk staff right on their game, luggage delivered to the room in minutes. Housekeeping was low key, handling both cleaning and turn down without us ever noticing. My favorite bar in town is Freddy's, that being Freddy Heineken, whose family owns the hotel, that has been rebuilt with all the charm. Both Gert, 20 year employee, and Marcel, 10 years, still give the best service in town. Along with the physical remodel, food and beverage has radically changed, for the better. We found ourselves eating often in the hotel. Room service was prompt, food actually still warm! Of course the location is perfect, the view from the breakfast room is of the Amstel, elegant, yet laid back. I used to stay at the Sofitel Grand, 20 visits worth, and I cannot say the same about that remodel, the charm completely gone. We had come from the Connaught in London, which I love, but my friends and I both agreed, L'Europe was at least as good, or better. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Stately Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: croquet_team
Reviews.Content: You'll receive a friendly reception from everyone, including the concierge, bellmen, and waitstaff at this 5-star establishment. Everything is plush and immaculate. A rather impressive property. The tram stop is literally just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: CharlieCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and had chosen DeL'E as it was located within reasonable walking distance of the main attractions. We took a taxi from the airport and the cost was just under â‚¬45. This was in a large multi seater and the driver assured us that he would charge the same as a "standard" car. As the cost going back was about the same and it was then "rush hour" this seemed to have been the case. Going back we booked the taxi ourselves (TCA as recommended by other reviewers) and it arrived in about 10 minutes from our call. The hotel staff throughout were very friendly, efficient and helpful, although we had done a lot of research and had planned our trips out, so I do not think we needed much help on that aspect. We had booked a junior suite with a canal view, and this room was absolutely fine in terms of size, view and facilities and as we had expected. We were offered an upgrade for an extra â‚¬300, but declined this. The bed was very comfortable and the nespresso machine was a welcome addition, although a small kettle would have been useful to make tea, rather than having to use water from the nespresso which had a coffee taste. The complimentary bottled water was a nice touch. The lighting on the wardrobe side of the room is not very bright though, so not easy to see inside. Occasionally the room was cold on returning after a day out, so it is possible that this may have been on a timer? The bed was very comfortable, although like other reviewers the automatic lighting system was a bit strange - difficult to read in the bathroom if the lights suddenly go out. Perhaps a simple guide for the room basics might help here! Also as has been mentioned the internet access was at times a bit slow, and on one occasion non-existent.. We ate in the brasserie on two evenings and the service and food was very good, we also had some excellent cocktails in Freddy's bar. The wine list in the brasserie contained many choices that were expensive, but amongst these were a handful of perfectly acceptable wines at a reasonable price for the quality hotel that it is. Breakfast was OK, a nice range, but the cheese and meat on one morning were a little "tired" looking, but it was our latest start and no doubt would have looked better earlier on. Housekeeping were too efficient, in that any bathroom product that had been opened seemed to be replaced on a daily basis. If these are discarded it is wasteful and unnecessary. We bought 2 Holland Passes (5 entries each) at a total of â‚¬88. We were left with 2 windmill passes, but even so after visiting the Van Gogh and Rijks museums, the new and old church, the Hermitage and doing a canal tour, we still got our money's worth. Of these our favourite was the Hermitage (and also had a good lunch there). I think we would have visited all regardless of whether we had the pass, so it was not a question of "we must get our money's worth". We also visited the Anne Frank house which is not in the Holland Pass, but very worthwhile and attended the free concert on Wednesday lunchtime at Concert Gebouw - extremely popular even in early March and I do not think there were any spare seats, not sure if this was due to the quality of the performance, the fact that it is free, or that it was pouring with rain - however we enjoyed it. The disappointing visits were the two churches, the old as it was being renovated and those parts that were visible were not all that impressive and the new as the exhibition it contained effectively meant that you could not really see the building itself all that well. On the subject of food we had a good lunch at Ristorante Pizzeria Isola Bella at Thorbeckeplein and also at Cafe de Jaren just down the road from the hotel. Overall we enjoyed our visit to Amsterdam, we think the length was about right for seeing the main attractions that we wished to see and it is a good city to walk around - mostly flat, with just the occasional bridge over a canal having an incline! One final point, as we wanted to travel from Bristol we flew with easy jet and paid for speedy boarding - going out was fine, but coming back they did not differentiate between those who had paid extra for SB and those who had not, so it was a waste of money paying the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but substandard internet makes it difficult for business”
Reviews.Author: fiddleleaf
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was quite luxurious, it is not the best choice for business travelers. I was disappointed in the internet access -- only wireless access was available, and the signal was unstable and poor. At times the internet was very slow and not really usable. Definitely disappointing, given the price range of this hotel. The internet connection was too slow for a good remote connection to my office network. I would have really preferred a wired connection. I heard that the hotel had recently been renovated, and it was indeed beautiful. My room was decorated in red and black (very Dutch), with a spacious white marble bathroom. There was ample closet space and a huge bed. Although the room was a nice size, the desk was very small and cramped. It was difficult to do any work at this desk. The service was generally excellent and responsive. The room service menu was on the hotel's website, which you access on the provided iPad. You can also order using the iPad, something that they recommend. However, you still have to call for the soup and dessert of the day, something that they should be able to update on their site daily. Since I had to call for this information anyway, I always wanted to order while on the phone. They would politely request that I put in my order on the iPad, but I didn't understand why I should bother going back to the iPad when I had someone on the phone to take my order. In addition, every time the iPad sleeps (after 10 minutes of inactivity or so), you have reconnect to the internet service provider through the hotel website. This might be understandable for your personal computer, but for the iPad provided by the hotel, it was a nuisance. It would be like having to log in to the hotel's TV service before watching TV, instead of just turning the TV on. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you don't expect to do any work while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: EvansSullivan1921
Reviews.Content: i do not often feel compelled to write glowing reports about hotels or the service that i have experienced although after our stay at the De L'Eroupe i really feel i should comment in the hope that others travelling to Amsterdam experience the same quality of service from the De L'Europe hotel as we did. My boyfriend and i have just returned from the De L'Europe hotel. We have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world and i can honestly say that this hotel is one of the best we have ever stayed at. Not just due to the hotel but mainly the wonderful staff employed by the hotel. Nothing was too much trouble and everyone from our driver to the waiting staff had a unique quality of making you feel very special. From the moment i booked the hotel the guest relations team were fantastic. Titta in particular was extreamly helpful. Titta organised a wonderful room that overlooked the river and was simply stunning. I received a pre booking form asking some basic information including what temp we would like the room and what pillows we would like. Not many hotels offer such options pre check in. On our arrival at the airport our driver called my mobile to check we had arrived safely and to confirm where we were in the airport. He was waiting for us with a huge smile and a hand shake. It was a welcome start to a lovely weekend. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted with the concierge manager who couldnt have been more helpful. We arrived quite early and were given a room to freshen up and change as our room would not be ready until a little later that day. This was such a lovely gesture as most hotels would only offer luggage storage! On returning to the hotel a little later that morning, Titta who i made the booking with came and personnally showed us to our room this again was such a lovely touch. We were shown to our stunning room where rose petals were left on the bed and in the bathroom. All rooms have Ipads and docking stations adding that little extra comfort and facilities to the rooms. There was a welcome gift on our arrival of a bottle of wine on ice. The food and service in each of the restaurants were faultless. Ralph from the Promenade is truly an asset to the De L'Europe hotel, his friendly nature and manner make you feel as if you have made a lifelong friend. The management team must have searched the whole of Amsterdam for such wonderful staff. its very rare that you find a hotel that is stunning and has the staff to match but i can honestly say that from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. My boyfriend and i look forward to visiting this wonderful hotel agian very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FirstTravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: After its recent complete renovation, De L'Europe is now one of the very best hotels in Amsterdam. Mixing classic traditional with modern contemporary, the result is stunning. The rooms are all themed in different colours, some rooms are blue, others red, grey or white. Our junior suite was blue with a magnificent view over the Amstel river. Free use of an Ipad in the room, free wifi and ipod docking station and a Nespresso Machine were all included. The white marble bathroom had underfloor heating, a huge bathtub and rainforest walk-in shower. We did not try the restaurants but the open-kitchen concept of the Brasserie was attractive and the red-themed lobby bar, which also does afternoon-tea, was slightly quirky but stylish. There is a small gym and indoor pool with view over the canal downstairs. The traditional dutch Freddies bar seemed popular with non-residents as well. An excellent choice next to Muntplein at the top of Damrak means you are within walking distance of almost anywhere in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel De L'Europe”
Reviews.Author: George702
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend loved our stay Hotel De L'Europe, The concierge Mr.Bronsveld planned each night beautifuly. They scheduled the best restaurants and places to go to aswell as put us on the guestlist to certain nightclubs. Everybody there was very friendly and helpful. This hotel is also in the center of Amsterdam. It was our first time in Amsterdam and it was the best New Years we've ever spent. The view of the canals from our room were very excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Freddy's Bar in Hotel De L'Europe”
Reviews.Author: emydo
Reviews.Content: We visited Freddy's after spending a day in Amsterdam. It is a relaxed environment and a perfect place when you need to take a break from the adventures of Amsterdam. The view over the canal and Munttoren is simply stunning. The cocktails are delicious! If you aren't sure about what to choose the staff can give you tips and you just might find a new favourite. The staff is social and friendly, providing excellent service. We had a lot of fun joking with the staff and will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DaydreamerJ
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel De L'Europe (January 15, 2012) and was totally wowed by my experience. It was my first time there and I was thrilled. The renovations are complete and it is gorgeous inside. The public spaces are beautiful (didn't have a chance to eat there since the restaurant is closed on Sundays and Mondays) but the bar is great as is the area where you can have tea. I was upgraded to a Junior Suite, a blue room overlooking the canal. It was a "clean room," which means everything was pristine and there was an air filter going 24/7. The bathroom had both a tub and a shower and a heated floor. The staff was very and welcoming (despite the fact that I showed up with just a backpack for luggage) and went out of their way to make me feel at home. Highly recommended. I have stayed at a lot of different hotels in Amsterdam - this is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great cocktail bar”
Reviews.Author: MattyboyLeiden
Reviews.Content: We went here recently and definitely want to return, it has a real cool retro feel to it. The prices are high for cocktails, but good quality. The only gripe I have is they weren't very happy when one of us ordered a cup of tea...but other than that I look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: kitty064
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay at the hotel but had dinner at the Hoofdstad Brasserie. Got table overlooking the water - and enjoyed the Christmas lights reflecting in the water. Food good value. Would recommend the tournedos (a la carte). Also the starter course salad with beetroot and the Creme brulee. Coffee comes with petit fours - nice touch. The waiter was very concerned that I hadn't finished my main course. Lovely spot for a romantic dinner in a unique location at an affordable price. Strange how Amsterdammers don't seem to have discovered it yet. Mostly foreigners there. Looking forward to trying it again in the summer - and hopefully sit out on the terrace

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay at the Hotel de L'Europe in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: V_Pagano
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently made our seventh trip to this beautiful city. Each time, we have stayed at the Hotel de L'Europe where we are treated not just as guests but as returning family members. The last two stays have been subsequent to the fantastic renovation that the hotel received. The rooms are beautiful with every modern comfort, while still incorporating old world charm, that you can imagine. It is as comfortable as it is beautiful with a fabulous location and a great staff who care about your every need. We know so many by name (they know us as well!) that I do not want to name them for fear of forgetting to name at least one of our friends there! We are planning another visit next April and are really looking forward to our visit. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificently Renovated- Better Than The Amstel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerbill
Reviews.Content: We were personally greeted by Mr. Jeroen Bronsveld (Front Office Manager) upon arrival. He escorted us to a beautiful Red Suite with views of the Amstel river and the city. A bottle of Billecart-Salmon Champagne was then sent to the room. Both Mr. Bronsveld and Titta (in Guest Relations) were aware that we were celebrating a special occasion. We had a wonderful celebratory dinner at Bord'Eau that evening- only an elevator ride away. The hotel has just been magnificently renovated (it is owned by the Heineken family). There is marble- marble- marble- and more marble- all slabs matched perfectly with each other. Every room comes with its own iPad. The entire staff could not be more warm, welcoming and friendly--including the doormen and the wait staff at breakfast and tea. The concierge (Eef Sparla) arranged our tickets to both the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum--just a short walk from the hotel. The location of this hotel is superb--whereas The Amstel Intercontinental is remote--STAY HERE !--we definitely made the correct decison ! The hotel was just featured in an article in the Sunday New York Times travel section. We are longing to return here on our next trip to Amsterdam !!!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JRTravellerLux
Reviews.Content: Smooth arrival with the doorman taking charge of our car immediately (garage is expensive but that is normal for Amsterdam). Some difficulties with check-in as our package was not well transmitted by LHW. After verification all was settled well and all LHW advantages (upgrade, welcome gift, etc..) were considered. We booked a De Luxe One Bedroom Suite and were upgraded to a Prestige One Bedroom Suite with a small balcony and view of the Munt Tower and the Amstel River. Very spacious separate living area and a small but cosy bedroom with a great bed. The room was very comfortable and pleasant to stay in. During our stay the staff was always very friendly and helpful. (Special thanks to Mrs. Jacqueline GrÃ¤tz who really made us feel at home). Most of the time we were addressed with our family name, which is exceptional. Breakfast sometimes a little disorganised, depending on the staff. All in all we had an excellent time in hotel de l'Europe and when in Amsterdam again, we will surely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! European Luxury at it's finest!”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Black_DOSM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early July and it was absolutely fantastic! We were traveling with a lot of family (which is stressful enough!) but once we got to the hotel everything was at ease. It is a little challenging to find the entrance with the construction on the street in front, but once we got inside everything was fantastic. From the doorman to the Front Desk, everything was great. The rooms we had overlooked the canal and were spectacular. As a techno-geek, the in-suite iPad and Bose sound system you could control in the bathroom was awesome! We had breakfast in the cafe, and despite a snooty guest beside us, everything was fabulous. One night we organized to leave the kids behind, and they organized a fabulous babysitter for us (Ann Flor?) who took care of our precious kids. The new part of the hotel is just great! We did have one room in the older part which was still nice and spacious, but compared to the new room wasn't nearly as nice. We had one "glitch" which I won't mention, but the staff dealt with it efficiently which is what you would expect. Courteous and centrally located, if you are looking for a luxury hotel, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Poor management. Should not be a part of lhw”
Reviews.Author: bladams79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a family vacation last year. The hotel is very nice though not up to the standards of other 5 star Lgw hotels in Europe. I would peg the value of a room here at $350us max. I booked a return visit for next feb on kayak at a rate of $260us. I dont mind paying for top quality as I am paying 800 a night at the ritz Paris on the nights prior to this stay. I prepaid for the room last week and received an email from the booking service I used this morning saying the hotel had made a mistake and was not going to offer the rate they had charged my card. No call from hotel management. No call from hotel to explain. Just a form letter from easy to book. I would expect that a hotel that claims to be of this class to manage a situation better. Instead of rebooking at this hotel I have booked at hotel Pulitzer. This really rubbed me the wrong way. I think they have an overinflated view of what thir rates should be. I booked Ritz Paris through same service and have already received email from the hotel asking if I have any special requests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Y100
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here before the renovation I was already impressed however two years on this has become one of the finest in Europe yet retained its rich heritage in the process. The rooms, public areas and service are all exceptional along with the food and famous 'Freddy's bar'. Take my hat off to Kees on the door who knows all the local info.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Under construction at the time of review...”
Reviews.Author: BillScurry
Reviews.Content: ...so things are subject to change. I loved this hotel in spite of the hammering and sawing, because of the gorgeous physical plant and comfort of the well-appointed rooms. The location in the center of Amsterdam is advantageous to efficient touring, and the staff was helpful and accommodating. If in the old town again, I would enthusiastically stay here again. Oh, and the bathrooms are HUGE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, but it's the staff that puts it over the top!”
Reviews.Author: DaringMiss
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about booking Hotel De L'Europe for our recent trip to Amsterdam based upon the reviews on Trip Advisor, but there was no need. The hotel was fabulous! We booked a Junior Suite with a river view and found it to be perfect for our needs. We travel a lot on business and prefer a living room separate from the bedroom. That is exactly what our junior suite provided without the full suite price. The ceilings in our suite were high, and combined with the river view really added so much to the room. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful - done completely in blue mosaic tiles - not marble like everyone seems to be doing these days. Well lit, excellent water pressure and the tub was a dream! Other reviewers have commented on the internet connection, but we experienced no problems. The Bose system even played our US dvds which was terrific at the end of the day. The location of the hotel is wonderful - located in a charming neighborhood and central to so many of the things you will want to see, but quiet enough to relax. But it was truly the staff that made our stay so wonderful. The check in was smooth and charming. The bell staff was helpful (showing us the controls for the room) and efficient. The concierge was great - made us reservations at a romantic restaurant for our special dinner and helped me ship items home to the US (customs paperwork is so annoying). The delightful reception staff gave me clear directions a couple of times that made finding odd things (like super glue) a snap. We will definitely be staying at Hotel de L'Europe again.

Reviews.Title: “A historical but chic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FAY1357
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here, everything from the rooms to staff to service was great. We specially enjoyed the breakfast and the room in which it was served every morning. The hotel is located in the center of action where all the shops and restaurants are but the rooms are very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Generally wonderful, with a few glitches, and poor internet access”
Reviews.Author: someflipster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is physically beautiful and well designed. The bed in my room was enormous, and the bathroom is luxurious. My room had a little balcony, just big enough for one person to sit on a chair and relax and enjoy the view of the canal, which was fabulous. The staff were very polite and helpful. The pillows were large and comfortable. Bath robes were luxuriously heavy. The bathroom was wonderfully appointed with numerous towels of many sizes, which I liked. One thing they definitely got right here is the towel supply in the bathroom- I didnt count exactly, but there were on the order of 15 big towels in the bathroom. Perfect! I like to take several baths during the day when relaxing on vacation, especially after I've been out walking in the hot summer sun. The housekeeping was pristine. They spent 30 minutes to an hour each day cleaning up the room, vacuuming the floors, putting everything into pristine condition. Very pleasant and refreshing. Glitches - one of these for me was the internet. If you don't care about the quality of the internet access and only need to occasionally check some emails, skip the next few paragraphs. If you need good internet service for work-related or personal reasons, this is an important thing to know about this hotel. Wired internet access is not available, though the telephones in the room were IP telephones, with "Ethernet" ports marked on the side. I plugged a cable in to this port but could not get a connecton; when I asked about it, I was told these ports were inactive and only wireless is available. This means that the hotel has a working intranet, which is how the phones work, and they *could* turn on the Ethernet ports on the telephones with minimal expense if they wanted to. However, they have chosen not to. Wired internet would be useful for many guests, who have devices that require a wired connection, or for when the wireless signal is not fast enough. The wireless internet seems to be capped at maximum speed of 1 megabit per second. Generally, I found my download speeds to be around 0.7 mbps, sometimes as slow as 0.3 or 0.4 mbps. When I complained about this to hotel management, I was told "Sorry, there's nothing we can do, if many guests are using the internet at the same time it will become slow." This response is way behind the times. If a guest picked up the telephone and got no dial tone, would they say "Sorry, looks like many guests are using the phone at the same time, so we can't give you a phone line." Or if there were no hot water in the morning, "Sorry, many guests have used hot water this morning, the hotel no longer has any hot water." Or if the electricity went out, would they say many guests are using electricity at the same time, there is not enough electricity left for you? This is ridiculous and reflects a very old-thinking mentality about the interwebs. It CAN and IS possible to wire the hotel properly to GUARANTEE each and every room fast internet. I won't get into the details, but this is bread and butter IT work and would actually be quite inexpensive to do. Give me a monthly budget equal to one or two days Checking online, the average home in Amsterdam can get 120 megabit/second internet connectivity by cable modem for 50 euro a month from UPC netherlands. Other service providers offer similar speeds and prices for fiber optic, cable, and DSL connections. Wikipedia states that the Netherlands is tied with Switzerland as the most connected country on the planet, and this hotel is near the Amsterdam city center. They have no excuse for not offering better internet service. Comparing this hotel to other 5-star hotels in Amsterdam, at the Hilton I never had download speeds slower than 6 megabits per second when I stayed there, which was satisfactory. Also, the wireless signal was poor. Since wired internet was not available, it would be important to have good wireless signal. I found that I could not maintain a wireless connection reliably in the bathroom (using iPad in the bathtub) or on the balcony. Even in the room, there were "good" locations and "bad" locations. I found the best location and did my work there. That's pretty sad, especially when they don't even offer a wired connection. A few other minor things.... The room service menu was sparse, even though the hotel restaurants have lots of items that weren't offered. When I asked for a menu, they suggested I look at the menu on the in-room iPad, which opened a web browser to the menu on the hotel website, which was slow. It was difficult to review the menu as only a certain # of things fit on the screen at any one time, and it was slow switching between categories since the internet connectivity was poor. When I asked for a physical menu, I received a stack of paper that had been printed from a printer. A regular printed menu would be more convenient. Room service quality was also spotty. Several of the dishes were quite tasty and well prepared, but overall consistency and attention to detail were lacking on a few occasions. Once they brought me a cheese platter and a bowl of soup at dinner, without any bread. When I asked for bread, they brought three small and unappetizing rolls, which looked and felt like they had been sitting on a shelf for a few days, and which were insufficient for soup and a cheese tasting platter. They also delivered an ice cream dish along with a big meal which was melted by the time it was time to eat it. Couldn't they think of some measure to prevent this, put it on ice, deliver it later, put it in some form of insulation? Anyway the hotel is overall quite beautiful, gorgeous rooms and generally excellent service, but with a few glitches. They need to bring room service up to snuff, with a larger variety of things to order and better attention to detail. And, the internet service is far behind the times, especially for a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Treatment at this Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: urbanetraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the most AMAZING stay at the beautiful De Lâ€™Europe. From the moment we entered the hotel, we were warmly welcomed by the General Manager (which is unusual at hotels these days), as well as the accommodating and oh so sweet Marie Julie Craeymeersch and Lizette Hassell. Marie Julie had been my initial contact at the hotel and she definitely went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of and spoiled. Everyone we encountered at the hotel beginning with the doormen, restaurant and bar staff to housekeeping and the entire concierge staff was both helpful and friendly. From the beautiful room overlooking the Amstel River to the comfy bed, radiant heated bathroom (which has every amenity desired, plus someâ€¦including full size samples of shampoo, conditioner and bath gel, a makeup mirror, an abundance of fluffy towels, bathrobes and slippers) we absolutely LOVED it and canâ€™t recommend it enough, even to the most picky travelers. We are in the media, have traveled throughout the world and stayed at some of the most exclusive properties. De Lâ€™Europe is certainly among the best and is five star on all levels from its ideal location, luxury accommodations, delicious food and superior service. Special Note: We want to thank all of those of you at De Lâ€™Europe for the extra special touches you provided us during our stay! We were greeted by a fresh floral display in our suite, along with champagne. When we returned to our room, there was a gift in celebration of our anniversary, as well as a fruit basket, each left for us with personal notes. Thank you to all of you at the hotel for your warm and most special reception during our stay in Amsterdam. De Lâ€™Europe is a gem in a charming city. Frankly, we canâ€™t wait to return and hope it will be soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Leah33308
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July 2011. Absolutely loved it and the service was fantastic. We had a suite type room with a river view.... The room was pricey, but made our trip... (they even provided us with an Ipad to use while in the room). Have our own, but thought this was a nice touch. Also great location for getting around the city. Free fast wifi is nice as well... surprised how many hotels don't over this.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: K1p1Granny
Reviews.Content: Location,service,staff,food and bars are all first calss. There is even a lovely well ventilated lounge off the bar for smokers! The only slight negative is that the lighting is rather dim. We were in the new rooms.Throughly enjoyable stay and a world class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “truly a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: delraydiva1
Reviews.Content: our reservation for a deluxe canal view room revealed itself as a corner room with floor to ceiling french doors and despite being on a lower floor offered a majestic view of the city..north to the dam and south to city hall. a small balcony with two wicker chairs allowed for a relaxing coffee while watching the daily life along the canal pass by... the room was luxurious in many ways including high ceilings, separate marble bath and shower, double sinks, instant hot water, abundant towels, fluffy robes and slippers, free wifi and even an in room IPAD for guest use! we dined at the brasserie where we found both the meal (fresh seafood) and service to be excellent. after a stroll through the city we finished the evening with a drink at Freddy's bar where the mood was congenial and lively. room service did not disappoint.. our english breakfast arrived on time and prepared exactly as ordered. the business lounge, open to all guests offers free internet access ...printing a boarding pass was effortless.... the hotel proved to be five star on all levels from location, service, food and accomodation...we are sure to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Easily best hotel in Amsterdam with a formal Afternoon Tea that beats The Ritz, London.”
Reviews.Author: BarryAscot
Reviews.Content: Easily best hotel in Amsterdam with a formal Afternoon Tea that beats The Ritz, London. This will soon be the very best hotel in Amsterdam....after they tweak a few things following my visit. It is already the best hotel in Europe for a grand English Afternoon Tea (with a twist) by a long way. Forget about any criticism you may have read in posts below. What these posts donâ€™t explain is that the new, refurbished Hotel De Lâ€™Europe has only been open for three weeks. Posts from last month and before were reporting on the building next door which was temporarily in use. Everything in the newly opened hotel is brand new. Reception is new, the restaurants are new, all of the furniture is new....and they are 95% of the way to being totally perfect. My only problems were at breakfast and at check-out but I doubt anyone else will have similar problems as I brought them to the attention of management who paid very close attention. The central location of this privately owned hotel is superb and perfect for everything. The new bedrooms are all superb, Iâ€™ve seen four of them, all equally good. Our suite was missing a room service menu; a DO NOT DISTURB sign and stationery......as a result we were bothered every few minutes on our last morning by staff wanting to prepare for the next guests. I've never had no "Do Not Disturb" sign before.....neither have I had such a sensational Traditional English Afternoon Tea in any hotel anywhere....the De Lâ€™Europe Afternoon Tea service could teach Londonâ€™s Ritz Hotel a thing or two. It was amazing. Forget The Ritz, book for tea at De L'Europe....and it's served with a smile and with pride. The technology in the rooms need a little adjustment but itâ€™s all there. I could never get the sound from TV/Music to work through the bathroom speaker in 518. Thereâ€™s superb automated lighting; TV; I-pod dock; phone system. The towels are of highest quality and fluffy as are the hotel slippers. The bathrooms are terrific in every way as are the extras. Donâ€™t bother risking leaks in your luggage, leave shampoos/conditioners and everything else at home. Everything supplied in the bathroom is worth using. The beds are of the highest quality and exceptionally comfortable. Room service is good. The hotel supplied us with a superb baby sitter one evening....we asked for a trustworthy female child-sitter.....they sent us a trainee lady paediatrician. Perfect. The kitchens are immaculate; the chefs are immaculate and the food served is immaculate. The views from both restaurants are stunning. I particularly liked the wine list. The lunch menu in the brassiere also lists wines available by the glass....and champagnes by the glass. I was seriously impressed because never before have I been anywhere, apart from the three Michelin rosette Waterside Inn in Bray, UK which serves my favourite drink, Ruinart Blanc de Blanc champagne by the glass. They also do Krug Grande Cuvee, Met Grand Vintage 2003 and others by the glass. This is THE OPPOSITE of the Crown Spa Hotel in Scarborough U.K. (see my review) where they serve nasty, flat champagne in a dirty glass! Now for afternoon tea:- Served in a beautiful area of the hotel known as The Promenade, next to a circular bar, tea, served from 3.00pm, overlooking the canal, was amazing. The staff bring out various teas as a way of building up the whole tea experience to a sort of crescendo. It is all really quite special. First tea up was Organic Sencha tea....a superb green tea. This was followed by a Darjeeling, Risheehat, 1st Flush vintage 2010 tea...actually made for further developing other time, as with a good wine....aromas of tropical fruit. Interspersed with all of this were perfect sandwiches and exceptional handmade pastries in wonderful colours and designs. The hotel employs the services of a serious pastry chef....and it shows. This was followed by Creative Thee (Gemengd) - Art Tea.....quite something. Served in a clear glass tea-pot this tea turned into a flower while we watched. Incredible. While this went on delicious pastries were served.....it was like a feast. Then came Chocolate tea. Itâ€™s worth staying at this hotel just for the tea. They have at least 24 different gourmet teas on the menu, from all over the world. Now for what went wrong. Our first two Breakfasts! Our first two breakfasts let the entire hotel down. Ordering breakfast was sad, incoherent with a total absence of fluidity. It's as if the waitress taking the order failed to hear every 2nd word of the order. It was a jagged and jarred experience.....lots of stop/start. Breakfast at the superb De L'Europe should be the icing on the cake.....the view over the canal of the old clock tower is lovely.....the chairs in The Brassiere where breakfast is served are comfy, crockery/cutlery/tableware are modern and immaculate and the cooked breakfasts are all freshly prepared......no tired looking scrambled eggs at this hotel AND the breakfast menu is extensive.....at least it would be if the kitchen didn't run out of items such as smoked salmon. Ordering any variation (for instance English breakfast without certain items) produces glazed, vacant expressions from the waitresses. Donâ€™t allow them to serve you. Ask for a male waiter. I think one of them also caused me trouble at lunch. There are two, non-Dutch waitresses, one pleasant but hopeless, the other has attitude and is similarly hopeless. The food is fresh/tasty... perfectly decent. What is completely untogether is the service which I can best describe as pitiful. I thought our painful first mornings breakfast experience on July 18th was perhaps a one-off when staff got most of our order wrong for all five of us, causing further lengthy delays upon delays however it's now clear to me that neither of the two female staff who served us listen and they are exceptionally incompetent. What they didn't get wrong, they forgot to bring. One of them was polite/smiley but hopeless.....she couldn't get anything right. The taller waitress actually wrote down our entire, detailed order on July 19th breakfast, then walked off without a word, or a smile.....then almost everything that turned up was wrong.....we also asked for hot chocolate for our children on sitting down.....nothing for half an hour. A third waitress taking my lunch order when the five of us sat at the chef's counter on our first day was rude.....muttering and huffing while attempting to correctly take my wine order. She didn't have a clue. However this was more than made up for by the terrific Head Sous Chef, Ton de Kulper, who was as excellent at ensuring we received everything we asked for as he and all the superb and well organised kitchen staff were at cooking and we enjoyed a perfect lunch on July 18th. At lunch the following day, waiters made a few mistakes such as pouring still water which we didn't order into sparkling water glasses but this was more than balanced by the superb table which the maitre 'd reserved for me and the view of endless cyclists pedalling by along the canal while holding umbrellas in the pouring rain (I'm not a fan of the cyclists after been run over by one a few years ago). At our second day's breakfast experience the waitress told me they had run out of smoked salmon. Pity as there's not much else my coeliac daughter will choose from the menu although there was gluten-free bread for her, which always receives much appreciation from us. One of four of my friends at another table (only staying at the hotel for the Take That stadium concert due to my recommendation), taking breakfast at the same time, ordered a smoke salmon bagel. He received his smoked salmon but was told they had run out of bagels. I ordered at the same time and was told there was no smoked salmon. How can the kitchen run out of smoked salmon at breakfast when they need it for the afternoon tea sandwiches? At our first breakfast I asked for fresh carrot juice. It turned up and was horrible.....clearly out of a bottle. At other Leading Hotels including Marbella Club, the Setai and Sandy Lane, only freshly made juices are ever served, including fresh carrot juice. However other Leading Hotels charge far more for breakfast. At this class of hotel, everything should be fresh but the hotel are entitled to charge for these extras. I would have happily paid for fresh carrot juice. The breakfast waitresses at De L'Europe nod, take the order and then it all turns up wrong. It's not as if breakfast is busy......most tables were empty at our second day's breakfast. I don't mind the wait at all given breakfast is, unusually, freshly cooked to order..... but I do mind the unnecessary additional wait when waitresses then need more time to correct their errors. It took them one whole hour just to produce hash browns for my coeliac daughter on our first breakfast. The self-service area for fruit/cereals/yogurt etc remained unreplenished for over half an hour.....they had also run out of cereal bowls. Am I being difficult, you may wonder? I don't think so.....this should be the top hotel in Amsterdam......and will be once their breakfast service is sorted out.....I've stayed at the others. Our second day breakfast took over half an hour to arrive.....an improvement over our first day. Our friends told me that 75 per cent of their breakfast order turned up completely wrong. Anyhow, that's what's wrong with breakfast. I ended up telling the breakfast staff what I thought of them. Breakfast on our third day was fantastic. Service was perfection. The food was lovely. The freshly squeezed orange juice was superb. Stefan, the Food and beverages manager saw to that. He explained to me that they have only been going for three weeks and that he aims to serve freshly made breakfasts in 15 minutes. He will get there although he may have to find another job for the useless waitresses.....they were beyond terrible. The guys were all terrific and the restaurant manager at breakfast is superb. This hotel was terrific. I give it full marks. Donâ€™t worry about breakfast......They had sorted it out by our third day. I suffer....you get the benefit. I know many Tripadvisor contributors have sorted out problems in advance for me in the past and so.....my gift to you.....is Hotel De Lâ€™Europe. Owned by the Heineken family. They have spared no expense. Itâ€™s terrific. The pool was immaculate, a pleasure to use. Stay nowhere else in Amsterdam. PS There are seats in the lift.....a nice touch....but check your bill....there were mistakes on mine which took well over an hour to resolve....no thanks to a stupid, back office woman in a black suit who was seriously annoying but worry not......all of the rest of the reception staff are good, as are the concierge staff and especially the font of house manager. Any problems, ask for him. Easily the best hotel in Amsterdam....I've stayed at the others and so I really mean it.

Reviews.Title: “It's all coming together!”
Reviews.Author: TAG54
Reviews.Content: We just spent three days at De l'Europe and are pleased to report that the challenges of renovations are behind them. The staff, particularly Jeroen Bronsveld, Jacqueline Gratz and Sasha Holzkamper could not have done more to make us feel welcome and appreciated. Our room had a spectacular view of the Amstel, it was quiet and service was top-notch. Our meal at Bord'Eau was spectacular (congrats to Chef Richard and his team). While there are still some minor transitional hiccups to address, the bottom line is that people care - and, it's nice to know that a professional team awaits your arrival and works to ensure that you do receive five-star attention and service.

Reviews.Title: “Under refurbishment.......”
Reviews.Author: businestrav
Reviews.Content: The taxi had to drop us slightly away from the hotel so we had to walk with the luggage and through the side restaurant as there was no one to assist us and access to the front door looked closed. we reached their make shift reception and then were taken into a lift with no lights. The room was nice but there were snagging issues still to complete. we were then woken up early in the morning with banging from workers. I just wish the Hotel mentioned at the time of booking and on their website that they were under refurbishment. Despite our complaints no one from the senior management seemed to care. Hopefully once the refurbishment is done this will return to being a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Ashiya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business last week. It did not serve our party well at all. I ordered room service breakfast the night before by putting the order sheet on the door, as one does. I had given a fifteen minutes window, but no breakfast arrived at the end of that time period. I phoned Room Service but got through to the receptionist. She said that she would get her colleague to call me back. This went on for some time. In the end, I said to the receptionist that I did not want a phone call, and that I wanted breakfast. It finally arrived twenty-five minutes after the said period. Just as well that I had planned to have a plenty of time. One of the people in the party had someone walking in on him in his hotel room. When he complained about it, I was less than impressed by the way the receptionist dealt with it. We will not be using the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations almost completed”
Reviews.Author: PSUvikings
Reviews.Content: Note to webmaster: Why is this property listed twice? See also ranking #47 of the same hotel. We visited Amsterdam in early June, and were most pleased with our stay at this fine hotel. Renovations are nearly comple, and it looks to be a dazzling hotel, with a great location and fine restaurants. This is a 5 star hotel, and I highly recommend it for those fortunate enough to be visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Look for this hotel to be one of the world's finest”
Reviews.Author: butravel
Reviews.Content: I knew the hotel was under construction until the end of May, but the section we stayed in was complete and there was no inconvenience to us other than the new restaurants not yet open. What a room!!! The colors were based on a large reproduced Rembrandt painting hung in the room and the features are too many to list. They gave us wonderful service and provided everything you would expect from a top european hotel. Look for them on every top 10 list by year's end.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel, but its under construction...”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSims
Reviews.Content: The staff are some of the best I have encountered in Europe, no attitude, and extremely good service. The location of the hotel is perfect, though complicated to get to if you have rented a car due to construction, not only of the hotel, but the street in front (your nav. will take you the wrong way). The room was spacious, but gloomy even with 3 windows facing out.. I dont know if the room was one that still needed to be remodeled, or if it was one of the finished rooms.. the style of it was very french chic circa 1981, and I mean that in a very good way.. as that is totally current... however the lighting was deplorable...and felt like something out of the "Eyes of Laura Mars" film ... they had to bring an extra floor lamp to use with my lap top, and the hall leading to the bed room was too dark to read the thermostat clearly... but staff were wonderfully accommodating and apologetic, making one feel rather ok about it ..

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels a real leading hotel 100% excellent sevice”
Reviews.Author: nurit76
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights in this nice paradise -the service was the best you could wish -we had a beauitful suit !!the breakfast was great and served on time every morning , room service and housee keeping excellent reception/concierge always with a smile, very helpful and very efficent- - this will be our hotel at our next visit to Amsterdam !!Thank you !!,Fam.. Manor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Deluxetravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last week with our 2 kids and we enjoyed the hotel very much. The downtown location of the hotel is quiet and superb, we did not have to use our car during our three nights stay. The staff was very attentive and helpful. Even if the main building is under complete renovation at the moment it did not effect our stay at all. Don't miss the indoor-pool, overlooking the Amstel-river. The a la carte-breakfast was delicious (our son loved the chocolate basket). The bathroom was breathtaking huge (BVLGARI soaps and shampoo) and with an integrated TV-flatscreen truly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Why the Bad Reviews?”
Reviews.Author: Lovz2Travel
Reviews.Content: Why the bad reviews? The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. By the second day we were there, everyone knew our names. They were very personable. Got upgraded to a recently remolded Dutch masters suite with a lovely view of the cannel. The room was spotless as well as beautiful. Enormous bathroom with high technology including a tv over the tub, floor heaters, and surround sound system. Well located, but everything in Amsterdam is an easy walk away form each other. When coming to Amsterdam, this hotel is a must!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler301
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, neat and organized. The staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating. I definitely plan to stay at this hotel on future trips to The Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: sapnaparekh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. centrally located. walking distance to any sightseeing place in the city. great breakfast in restaurant next to the canal. courteous n helpful staff. spacious room with big bathroom. Only no internet in room. cafes bars restaurants shopping tram stop all close to the hotel. expensive but worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A COLD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 4seasons50
Reviews.Content: The welcome of this hotel was as cold as the design of the new wing. The decor is awful. Dark and depressing with this ugly blow up of a Rembrandt staring down at the bed. There is no soundproofing. We could hear people in the street outside and in the room next door as if they were all with us in our room. The bottom mattress was not covered. The automatic lights drove us crazy. If you just lean over towards the edge of the bed they pop on and do not go out for at least ten minutes. The bathroom was tiled in a dark purple and the shower ran all over the room. The toiletries were skimpy. Breakfast was nothing special and they rolled in an ugly cart with grey plastic containers to pick it up. We tried having dinner in the small and dark restaurant. The first thing we were told was they had run out of most items on the menu. This was at 8:00 and the restaurant was not busy. We also felt that the doorman was in league with the taxi driver. We asked him to take us to the train station but he bullied us into delivering us to the airport train station instead. We felt that we had been taken advantage of. This hotel has an excellent location, but at this time with all of the work going on it is a big mess. There is no pool as advertised and no restaurant on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A140
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my way to Aruba and on the way back from Curacao earlier in the year. We had booked via lhw.com so got good rates on superior rooms etc. Upon arrival I found that my bags had not arrived the hotel staff provided my with lots of hygieneproducts deo,hairbrush, toothbrush/paste etc. I also got a chocolate version of a Rembrandt painting, some genever(dutch liquer) with gold leaf in it which is traditional for a Dutch bride to get. I also got a lot of other little gifts around the room, champagne, chocolates, fruit etc. Great attention to detail. On my return trip I stayed in a different suite, not in the new part of the building. The bathroom was modern but too squashed, there are glass walls between the tiolet and the shower, very strange , the room was fine but the decor was a little shabby, light fittings hanging off the wall in our hall area, very dated even for the type of building it is the room decor needs to look clean not dated. I had food in my room as I was flying early during each stay, mostly brekfast , typical dutch fare, not great but adequate. Would I stay here again , probably but thats only because I stayed there during my honeymoon. Would it be my first choice in Amsterdam, no. Only for two things, I know amsterdam well and it's just an alright location for me. I have stayed in lesser "styled rooms" but in much better hotels and for a more reasonable price and the rooms had balconies that were modern, in fact for the balcony we had to book a suite in this hotel. If you stay at the lesser star NH Doelen ( attached to this hotel ), you can have the same balcony overlooking the same canal for â‚¬300 cheaper a night........not great service at the Doelen but...it is a recession

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are amazing”
Reviews.Author: Discerning-Guest23
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect from the outside, but once in my room I was amazed. I was in one of the newly renovated rooms. Hardwood floors, steam shower, frette linens and bvgari amenities. The TV popped out of the bed. I had the chance to tour the new portion of the hotel which should open soon. These are brand new rooms and are amazing. They are very large and very high tech. The location is perfect. You can walk anywhere in 20 minutes. The hotel goes out of their way to help. It was raining and they let me borrow an umbrella. Once the new section opens with the updated fitness center, this property will be one of the best small hotels in the world. If you are questioning the value, go for it, its worth it, you only live once...

Reviews.Title: “It was Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Monapancakes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right in the middle of everything. The staff was helpful and so so nice. The rooms were amazing and very very clean. The price was higher than most of the other hotels but it is worth the extra money. All in all a beautiful and great place to stay. I probably wouldn't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, 1st class service”
Reviews.Author: Georgia62uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. I booked it as was one of very few good hotels in Amsterdam that had smoking rooms. On arrival check-in was very quick and efficient. The guy on reception noticed when looking at my passport, that I would be staying there on my birthday. The room , overlooking Amstel river, was very big, with huge, very comfortable bed and lots of wardrobe space. (No coffee making facilities, but coffee delivered to room promptly, with lovely petit fours included at weekend) Wireless internet was available at reasonable rate. The bathroom , all done in marble, with lovely Bvulgari toiletries, had separate toilet and bidet area, shower and bath. We didnt eat in restaurant but the room service food was excellent and the staff were more than happy to accomodate our requests. Breakfast was delivered to the room on time, and as with all the staff we were addressed by our names at all times. There was a lovely terrrace overlooking the river, but unfortunately this was closed due to inclement weather during our stay. We cant comment on the swimming pool or fitness area as we did not use, but was great for a city central hotel to offer this facility. Hotel de L'Europe is close to trams stops and within walking distance of both Dam square and Rembrandtplein. The Red Light District is only 15 min stroll away along the canal. We have never been to Amsterdam before but, we felt safe anywhere, anytime we went out. I really must commend the staff at this hotel. We hired a car and could not figure out the GPS system. The doorman, whose name I regret I did not learn, could not have been more helpful. He took time to show us and set our destination. Alexander, on reception also helped us with addresses. I have never stayed anywhere were the staff were so helpful and doing because they wanted to help, not just because it was their job. On my birthday, we returned to the room to find a gift left on bed for me. Nice touch! I really couldnt recommend this hotel highly enough. It may be pricey, but you get more than you pay for and this is rare.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjjtx
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Amsterdam from Stockholm after a week cruise in the Baltic. When we first saw our room, we were surprised at the dated decorating, but soon overcame that. Room was very large with three double closets, a very large marble bathroom, and lots of draw storage. Bed was very comfortable. Hotel felt empty although our porter told us it was sold out. After wandering around, noticed other side of our floor was closed and under construction. Never heard any noise, but it did account for the empty feeling in the common areas. Staff could not have been more helpful. Bikes are stored in basement and are available for rental. Mopeds are stored by stairs at entrance. Although we arrived after dinner, still could take a canal cruise in the evening that was within 25 yards of the hotel's front door. Breakfast which was included in our room rate was a buffet with certain items available for order from the menu. Selections were very good, and as an American, I found it all satisfactory. Tables are against large windows with canal views. Bar area was small, but bartender was interested in all the clients and made an effort to know your name and be helpful. Musical entertainer was appropriate for a bar - interesting but not overpowering. Drinks were expensive. Location was extremely convenient for us as first time tourists to Amsterdam. Saw Harry Potter across the street in a multiplex theater which was an awful experience, but everything else went very well. We love 5 star hotels. The room decor did not meet that standard, but everything else at this property made up for that. Everyone at the front desk is trained to be a concierge which was a different experience. We were able to buy tickets from them that avoided the long lines at certain popular attractions. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic stay in friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mart79
Reviews.Content: After saving up some money for a 5 star hotel we chose Hotel de l' Europe to celebrate our 3 year anniversary. As parking is difficult in Amsterdam we were very pleased that our car was parked for us in the hotels parking lot. The reception staf was aware of the anniversary and gave us a river view room which was super and we felt right at home. The room was spacious and clean. Breakfast was served in the Excelsior Restaurant and the waiter was attentive and friendly. We took a canal tour during the day and after we went shopping at P.C. Hoofdstraat to spend some more... Overall we have enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam and we would like to thank all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: radhikaIndia
Reviews.Content: its gr8 being in this hotel. I went their with my husband and daughter.it was gr8 fun their alltogether. service was very good. breakfast in the bed was really gr8 and besides the luxurious stay we had a gr8 fun ,all activities out their was real fuin for all of us. i am telling its worth going there.

Reviews.Title: “terrible condition & rip-off”
Reviews.Author: mmcin
Reviews.Content: For the birthday of my wife I reserved months ago an execut. suite for us and a single room for our daughter,who arrived from New York and we from Istanbul. We all have been several times in Amsterdam before (Hotel Krasnapolsky / Amstel Hotel) and we are a suite customer since very long time everywhere . The conditions of our suite (Nr 524) were terrible : 1) Very dirty carpets and furniture with smudge, so I had to clean some spots on the couch for sitting there. 2) Bath towels are not any more white,all became grey color and very rough 3) Handshower in the bath-tube was out of order,3 days no maintenance , even I reminded 3 times front desk. 4) No shoe spoon / no laundry bag/ no shoe cloth in the rooms 5) very dirty balcony 6) several electr. sockets in the living room were out of order 7) Corridor and hall on suite floor very dusty (constraction work on other floors) even I asked about constraction in the hotel before and they guaranteed there is not anymore work. 8) Personel enter rooms without knocking or ringing the bell The hotel needs a complete overhaul / qualified hotel managment Per night I paid in the suite for this mess 1000.-â‚¬ + 316.-â‚¬ for the single room (both without breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Location, but A Little Dated”
Reviews.Author: travelwithkids_7
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time at the hotel (last 2002) and the level of service has not slipped an inch. From the time we pulled up to the front door until we checked out, the staff were super attentive, helpful and friendly. Not much has changed at the hotel over the years, though in some respects it feels a little "dated." While there is elegance in the lobby and the room decor - it somehow feels like it need something new. In fairness, this is probably why people prefer the hotel for it's classic elegance. Also, the bathrooms were very updated and modern. The hotel itself is very quiet (though not sure if that was due to low occupancy or not), but the street our front (we faced the front) was very noisy as there was a lot of construction going on at all hours (sometimes it sounded like it was coming from the hotel or next door). The high speed internet is provided by telecom carrier KPN, not the hotel, and we found it to be slow most of the time. The hotel had a small pool that the kids enjoyed, although that may have been because we were the only ones in it at around 5pm. We will most likely stay here again on future trips due to the service and location, but would like to see a little change in the decor. The concierges were top knotch and had very helpful recommendations for restaurants. One that we particularly favored was Casa di David - excellent Italian food; it was packed so be sure to make a reservation. We also found Escape Caffe on our own to be a great lunch place, but turns into a club at night. Last piece of advice was that if you plan to visit any of the main sites - Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum or Anne Frank house, I would suggest an online booking before you leave home. We were able to pick our times and dates for all (Rijksmuseum is just the day, but open time). This allowed us to enter all 3 sites in under 5 minutes vs the long lines we say at each. A HUGE time saver and especially great if you are travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New Year!”
Reviews.Author: annic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de L'Europe over New Year 2008. We booked it for several reasons - not least of which it is one of the few hotels in Amsterdam which still allows smoking. The whole feel of the place is one of old European luxury. Our room had recently been refurbished and was the ultimate in comfort with a huge walk in shower and a spa bath - complete with TV. Just a couple of things to be aware of: the hotel does not offer tea and coffee making facilities in your room. As this is something we have become very used to this was surprising. The other thing was that at times the restaurant did seem to struggle with staffing and meals were a bit drawn out. As long as you aren't rushing this is fine but if you were in a hurry it could be difficult and it did seem to upset some guests. This could well have been the holiday period however. Other than that the experience was wonderful, the staff could not have been more helpful and if you can make use of the car service from the airport - a REAL treat!

Reviews.Title: “BEST OF THE BEST BY FAR”
Reviews.Author: nikosh
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent traveller for both business and pleasure, I have to say that Hotel De L'Europe has been one of the very best hotels I have ever stayed at. The location is excellent, the service is friendly and impecable and the rooms are spotless. It is both an architectural and historical monument and for all of us who are smokers it is still offering not only smoking rooms but also a wonderful smoking lounge with a beautiful view.Both restaurants in the hotel are considered to be of the best in Amsterdam and finally special thanks to the Concierge for all their helpful information. N.H. - Cyprus

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CzechTourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the last weekend before christmas. We booked it through our membership card of lhw.com. I would like to really emphasize the outstanding approach of the staff that is very rare and exceptional even in similar five star facilities. I believe this could be connected with the fact that the hotel is still privately owned by wealthy Dutch family. First of all, we checked-in early as we took early morning flight from Prague. It was absolutely no problem for the front desk. Secondly, we were upgraded from deluxe room to a beautiful spacious junior suite. And last but no least, we checked-out almost five hours after required time (after previous approval by front desk) and it was againg absolutely no problem and we were not charged any additional payment for this. The staff was helpful also in respect of our other requirements: taxi, reservations etc. The suite itself was very very spacious with beuatiful bed and antique style furniture. On the other hand, it was little bit dark and maybe little bit shabby. Anyway, this was no problem for us and we liked the suite very much as it was very convenient. I can also recommend the hotel "formal" restaurant "Excelsior". The food was outstanding and the view of Amstel river is very beautiful. On the other hand the price was quite high for every day dining and the wine was poor (its my fault as I selected it :o) but it was included in the section "recommended wines" so I hoped...). Our overall impression was very positive and we will definitely come backy in 2009 as we liked the hotel and Amsterdam itself very much!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: sicrsv
Reviews.Content: My parents decided to treat us to a luxury stay in Amsterdam. They chose the Hotel De L'Europe for my four children and I. They had good service and tasty food, though obviously quite expensive. The breakfast buffet was large, but not worth the price. We also didn't like the smoky aroma in the hotel lobby and halls. We had a non-smoking room, thankfully though. The air conditioning was fine. Very spacious bathrooms. Overall, it was a nice hotel, but not for the price that you pay. Also, they have computers in the lobby that you can use to get on the internet and stuff. It is ridiculously expensive though, at 12 euro for unlimited all day. We didn't try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: AgadorSpartacus
Reviews.Content: I was actually a little nervous about booking this hotel, based on other Trip Advisor traveller comments, but went ahead on the recommendation of a travel agent. It was a fantastic stay, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again! The hotel is in a great location, right on the River Amstel, and our room had a fantastic view overlooking the busy and fun water scene. We had our 8-year-old daughter with us, and the staff could not have been more friendly and sweet to her. The housekeeping staff always made sure to tuck her stuffed animals in when making up the room! The breakfast buffet, while expensive, was great. I can't understand other traveller complaints, because in addition to the table full of eggs, bacon ,sausage, breads, cheese, pastries, fruit, juice, yogurt, smoothies, etc, the buffet also includes made-to-order waffles, pancakes or omelettes. Great food, excellent service. The pool is very nice - it is small, and a little crowded when more than a few kids in it, but the warm temperature was great, and the pool staff very sweet with our daughter. One note: if you have very young children, or those that don't swim well, be aware that the shallow end of the pool is still pretty deep. Bring water wings if that's an issue... Overall a great stay. The front desk was super helpful with changing money, making Anne Frank internet ticket reservations for us, assisting with a window display jewelry purchase, etc. It's a lovely hotel, and we'd highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “A class act”
Reviews.Author: T&P&Co
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights over the Easter weekend, and had a great time. The hotel has a very luxurious feel. and maintains very high standards of service, including helpful reception staff, and an efficient maid service, with the Bulgari products in the bathroom regularly replenished. As it was Easter, we were given a small chocolate Easter gift on two evenings, and a chocolate bunny on departure. We dined one evening in Le Relais Brasserie, the less formal of the two restaurants, which we were very pleased with. We also considered the choice of food at the buffet breakfast to be reasonably comprehensive. The location of the hotel is fantastic for sightseeing; we walked everywhere. Amsterdam is a beautiful city, and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary present for husband”
Reviews.Author: Croft58
Reviews.Content: We did not book before we went and this hotel was one of the first we came upon as we drove into Amsterdam. We stayed for 4 days and had a wonderful time in the city and walked miles. The hotel was in a good location and clean. Staff were lovely and always helpful. Found it to be very expensive but enjoyed the luxury. No tea or coffee making facilities. Tea was a tea bag in hot water - no milk. Carpark is an added extra - will fly next time

Reviews.Title: “Kind of luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: euine
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed in hotel myself but booked for close people one night for 2 persons and 2 nights for one. Interior of the hotel is really nice and historic. Check in was quick and without problems. Having chosen run of house option while booking at hotel web site I hoped for the best they have, however as we arrived early (~10 a.m.) we were given quite modest standard room which might be good for 3-4 stars but for 5 stars hotel it needs some cosmetic renovation. There was a small window with view on flower market a bed of good size, a bit small bathroom. Air conditioner was producing sounds as if it was 20 years old. Lift which we used was very original - with soft bench. Another word about hotel's restaurant - we booked a table on the terrace, but without telling us in advance they closed it because there could be rain (there was no rain at that evening) and placed us in the center of the hall (not very pleasant). Sommelier was very helpful and helped us to choose the right wine, pianist was brilliant. Waiters were not so we had to pour that wine on our own. Food was of average quality - that is no bad but not very tasty. For 3 persons we've spent 268 euro. There is a very nice Freddy's bar with always fresh Heineken beer (3,5 euro per small glass). In general experience was more or less positive and in we paid 275 for first night and 268 for next 2 plus 12 euro per day of city tax. Breakfast was 25 euro per person but we haven't tried it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old-world hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: NYC304
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful old-world hotel right in the middle of Amsterdam and steps away from the flower market. The rooms are lovely and the service is exceptional. Rooms with balconies overlooking a canal are particularly pleasant. The meeting rooms are a little bit plain but there's nothing to complain about. Overally, my experience here was excellent and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: jacquestati
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel many times in the 1980s and on returning in April 2007 was delighted to find it as good as ever. Beautiful room, plenty of space, lovely bathroom, friendly and knowledgeable staff, everything working just as it should. And the restaurant is as good as ever -- yes, it should be, for the price. But it does everything well and there is the added delight of watching boats on the canals just below the restaurant window. What a pleasure to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every thing about it”
Reviews.Author: VickiHendon
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised that I loved the room and the location as much as I did. It was perfect for a first visit. I absolutely would come back to this hotel again. It is the best location of all the hotels to see everything in Amsterdam. I got the room upgrade with American Express booking which was wonderful the room was beautiful, the staff was gracious. It was perfect. I give it 5 star all the way around. I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Tired Decor”
Reviews.Author: gtgsf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July on our way to Turkey. The location is wonderful. It is right on a canal and walking distance to a tramline. I booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and photos I saw on the website. I am thankful we stayed on points and didn't have to pay the $500 plus it would have cost us per night. We booked 2 rooms, one with a king bed and one with twins for our girls. Thankfully, we were able to get rooms which had a connecting door. I can see that this Old World traditinal hotel was a grandly decorated hotel when new, but it could do with updating. It looked like Old World traditional. The bathrooms were marble, updated and a nice size though. We arrived during a heatwave so had to use the air conditioning which was barely passable. I found it annoying that housekeeping opened the windows when they cleaned the rooms, letting in all of the hot air, so we never came back at the end of the day to a cool room.
